content.rendered:
Ahmed Halimeh

Director of Health Informatics Research | Assistant Professor, Department of Information Science

Dr. Ahmed AbuHalimeh is an Assistant Professor of Information Science at University of Arkansas at Little Rock, he serves as a consultant for Arkansas Children’s Research Institute as well. He served as Research Informatics Program Manager at the Arkansas Research Institute-Arkansas Children’s Hospital and an Associate Professor of computer and information sciences at The American University of the Middle East, Kuwait for 5 years. He holds a master’s degree in information science in information quality, and a PhD degree in integrated computing from University of Arkansas at Little Rock. 
Dr. AbuHalimeh is an IEEE senior member, he has published in International Journal of Information Quality, IQ International, Health Open Access and International Journal of Intelligent Information and Database Systems. Dr. AbuHalimeh has extensive practical experience in helping organizations in establishing programs to utilize leading edge technologies and build solutions to improve the quality and reliability of its services and operational systems. He can assist in establishing the governance policies, procedures and standards and in building solutions to any information quality issues or concerns.

Areas of Expertise

  • Information/Data Quality
  • Blockchain Technology
  • Data Governance
  • Health informatics
  • Data Analytics and Human Computer Interaction Applications
